findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to stop or pause transactions
Contract Owner is not able to transfer tokens from specific address
findings.description: The contract owner lacks the ability to transfer tokens from a specific address.

findings.title: Owner Transfer User's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens and can take advantage of it by calling the `mint` function, resulting in highly inflated contract tokens.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to increase fees more than a reasonable percent (25%)
findings.description: The contract owner has unrestricted authority to modify fees, which can lead to unfair advantages.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to increase the amount of liquidity taken by dev wallet more than a reasonable percent
findings.description: The contract owner has limited control over increasing the amount of liquidity taken by the developer's wallet.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to mint new tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens but currently unable to do so.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to burn tokens from specific wallet
findings.description: The contract owner lacks the ability to burn tokens from a specific wallet.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to blacklist wallets from selling
findings.description: The contract owner lacks the ability to restrict specific wallets from selling tokens.

findings.title: Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Solidity defines a naming convention that should be followed.

findings.title: Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Functions that are not used in the contract, and make the code's size bigger.

findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens, which can lead to highly inflated contract tokens.
